title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement mbafs2012@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to AquaSensR
text: outlines propose change AquaSensR. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to AquaSensR
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to AquaSensR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to AquaSensR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("massbays-tech/AquaSensR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to AquaSensR
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to AquaSensR
text: Please note AquaSensR project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: Plot QC flag results for a continuous monitoring parameter — anlzASRflag
title: Plot QC flag results for a continuous monitoring parameter — anlzASRflag
text: Plot QC flag results continuous monitoring parameter

title: Plot QC flag results for a continuous monitoring parameter — anlzASRflag
code: anlzASRflag(flagdat)

title: Plot QC flag results for a continuous monitoring parameter — anlzASRflag
text: flagdat data frame returned utilASRflag.

title: Plot QC flag results for a continuous monitoring parameter — anlzASRflag
text: interactive plotly object.

title: Plot QC flag results for a continuous monitoring parameter — anlzASRflag
text: Produces interactive plotly time series showing observations line, non-passing observations overlaid markers. Marker colour indicates QC check fired: Gross range — red Spike — orange Rate change — purple Flatline — blue Marker shape indicates severity: Suspect — upward triangle Fail — cross (×) observation flagged multiple checks appears marker check fired, allowing sources concern visible. flagdat contains one site, plot uses vertically stacked subplots share common x-axis. Legend items shown apply across subplots.

title: Plot QC flag results for a continuous monitoring parameter — anlzASRflag
code: contpth <- system.file('extdata/ExampleCont.xlsx', package = 'AquaSensR') metapth <- system.file('extdata/ExampleMeta.xlsx', package = 'AquaSensR')  contdat <- readASRcont(contpth, tz = 'Etc/GMT+5', runchk = FALSE) metadat <- readASRmeta(metapth, runchk = FALSE)  flagdat <- utilASRflag(contdat, metadat, param = 'Water Temp_C') #> Error in utilASRflagupdategupdate(flag, "suspect", vals < meta$Tlower): could not find function "utilASRflagupdategupdate" anlzASRflag(flagdat) #> Error: object 'flagdat' not found

title: Check continuous monitoring data — checkASRcont
text: function used internally within readASRcont run several checks input data verify correct formatting downstream analysis. following checks made: Column names: include Site, Date, Time, least one parameter column matches Parameter column paramsASR Site, Date, Time present: columns required downstream analysis upload WQX least one parameter column present: least one parameter column matches Parameter column paramsASR required downstream analysis upload WQX Date format: format can recognized lubridate::ymd() Time format: format can recognized lubridate::ymd_hms() Missing values: missing values columns Parameter columns numeric: parameter columns numeric values

title: Check continuous monitoring data — checkASRcont
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  contpth <- system.file('extdata/ExampleCont.xlsx', package = 'AquaSensR')  contdat <- suppressWarnings(readxl::read_excel(contpth, na = c('NA', 'na', ''),      guess_max = Inf)) |>    dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(      dplyr::where(~ inherits(.x, "POSIXct") | inherits(.x, "Date")),    as.character))  checkASRcont(contdat) #> Running checks on continuous data... #> 	Checking column names... OK #> 	Checking Site, Date, Time are present... OK #> 	Checking at least one parameter column is present... OK #> 	Checking date format... OK #> 	Checking time format... OK #> 	Checking for missing values... OK #> 	Checking parameter columns for non-numeric values... OK #>  #> All checks passed! #> # A tibble: 927 × 10 #>    Site   Date       Time    `Water Temp_C` DO_pctsat DO_mg_L Conductivity_uS_cm #>    <chr>  <chr>      <chr>            <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>              <dbl> #>  1 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.9    6.44               410. #>  2 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.7    6.43               410. #>  3 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.6    6.42               410. #>  4 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.5    6.41               410. #>  5 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.3    6.4                409  #>  6 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.3    6.39               409. #>  7 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.2    6.39               409. #>  8 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.1    6.38               409. #>  9 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      76.5    6.41               404. #> 10 sud096 2024-08-14 1899-1…           24.2      77.6    6.5                399. #> # ℹ 917 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: TDS_mg_L <dbl>, Salinity_psu <dbl>, pH_SU <dbl>

title: Check continuous monitoring metadata — checkASRmeta
text: function used internally within readASRmeta run several checks input data verify correct formatting downstream analysis. following checks made: Column names: include Site, Parameter, Depth, Min, Max, Tlower, Tupper, SpikeFail, SpikeSuspect, FlatFailN, FlatFailDelta, FlatSuspectN, FlatSuspectDelta, RoCStdev, RoCHours columns present: columns previous check present least one parameter present: least one parameter Parameter column matches Parameter column paramsASR Parameter format: parameters listed Parameter column match Parameter column paramsASR Numeric columns: columns except Site Parameter numeric values

title: Check continuous monitoring metadata — checkASRmeta
code: library(dplyr)  metapth <- system.file('extdata/ExampleMeta.xlsx', package = 'AquaSensR')  metadat <- suppressWarnings(readxl::read_excel(metapth, na = c('NA', 'na', ''),      guess_max = Inf))  checkASRmeta(metadat) #> Running checks on continuous metadata... #> 	Checking column names... OK #> 	Checking all columns present... OK #> 	Checking at least one parameter is present... OK #> 	Checking parameter format... OK #> 	Checking columns for non-numeric values... OK #>  #> All checks passed! #> # A tibble: 7 × 15 #>   Site   Parameter        Depth   Min   Max Tlower Tupper SpikeFail SpikeSuspect #>   <chr>  <chr>            <lgl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>        <dbl> #> 1 sud096 Water Temp_C     NA        0    35   20     28.3         2          1.5 #> 2 sud096 DO_pctsat        NA        0   150   60     NA          25         10   #> 3 sud096 DO_mg_L          NA        0    12    4     NA           4          2   #> 4 sud096 Conductivity_uS… NA        0  1000   NA     NA          10          5   #> 5 sud096 TDS_mg_L         NA        0  1000   NA     NA         100         50   #> 6 sud096 Salinity_psu     NA        0    32   NA     NA           5          3   #> 7 sud096 pH_SU            NA        0    14    6.5    8.3        10          5   #> # ℹ 6 more variables: FlatFailN <dbl>, FlatFailDelta <dbl>, FlatSuspectN <dbl>, #> #   FlatSuspectDelta <dbl>, RoCStdev <dbl>, RoCHours <dbl>

title: Format continuous data — formASRcont
text: function used internally within readASRcont format input data downstream analysis.  formatting includes: Combine Date Time columns: Combines single DateTime column, converts POSIXct specified time zone. Convert non-numeric columns numeric: Converts columns except Site DateTime numeric already.

title: Format continuous data — formASRcont
code: contpth <- system.file('extdata/ExampleCont.xlsx', package = 'AquaSensR')  contdat <- suppressWarnings(readxl::read_excel(contpth, na = c('NA', 'na', ''),      guess_max = Inf)) |>    dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(      dplyr::where(~ inherits(.x, "POSIXct") | inherits(.x, "Date")),    as.character))  formASRcont(contdat, tz = 'Etc/GMT+5') #> # A tibble: 927 × 9 #>    Site  DateTime            `Water Temp_C` DO_pctsat DO_mg_L Conductivity_uS_cm #>    <chr> <dttm>                       <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>              <dbl> #>  1 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:56:33           24.2      76.9    6.44               410. #>  2 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:56:43           24.2      76.7    6.43               410. #>  3 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:56:53           24.2      76.6    6.42               410. #>  4 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:57:03           24.2      76.5    6.41               410. #>  5 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:57:13           24.2      76.3    6.4                409  #>  6 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:57:23           24.2      76.3    6.39               409. #>  7 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:57:33           24.2      76.2    6.39               409. #>  8 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:57:43           24.2      76.1    6.38               409. #>  9 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:57:53           24.2      76.5    6.41               404. #> 10 sud0… 2024-08-14 13:58:03           24.2      77.6    6.5                399. #> # ℹ 917 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: TDS_mg_L <dbl>, Salinity_psu <dbl>, pH_SU <dbl>

OK #>  #> All checks passed! #> # A tibble: 7 × 15 #>   Site   Parameter        Depth   Min   Max Tlower Tupper SpikeFail SpikeSuspect #>   <chr>  <chr>            <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>        <dbl> #> 1 sud096 Water Temp_C        NA     0    35   20     28.3         2          1.5 #> 2 sud096 DO_pctsat           NA     0   150   60     NA          25         10   #> 3 sud096 DO_mg_L             NA     0    12    4     NA           4          2   #> 4 sud096 Conductivity_uS…    NA     0  1000   NA     NA          10          5   #> 5 sud096 TDS_mg_L            NA     0  1000   NA     NA         100         50   #> 6 sud096 Salinity_psu        NA     0    32   NA     NA           5          3   #> 7 sud096 pH_SU               NA     0    14    6.5    8.3        10          5   #> # ℹ 6 more variables: FlatFailN <dbl>, FlatFailDelta <dbl>, FlatSuspectN <dbl>, #> #   FlatSuspectDelta <dbl>, RoCStdev <dbl>, RoCHours <dbl>

what: Flag continuous monitoring data with QC criteria — utilASRflag
title: Flag continuous monitoring data with QC criteria — utilASRflag
text: Flag continuous monitoring data QC criteria

title: Flag continuous monitoring data with QC criteria — utilASRflag
code: utilASRflag(contdat, metadat, param)

title: Flag continuous monitoring data with QC criteria — utilASRflag
text: contdat data frame returned readASRcont metadat data frame returned readASRmeta param character string naming parameter column evaluate. Must match one parameter columns present contdat one entries Parameter column metadat.

title: Flag continuous monitoring data with QC criteria — utilASRflag
text: data frame columns Site, DateTime, selected parameter, four flag columns: gross_flag, spike_flag, roc_flag, flat_flag.

title: Flag continuous monitoring data with QC criteria — utilASRflag
text: Applies four independent QC checks selected parameter every site contdat, matching thresholds metadat Site Parameter.  check produces flag ("pass", "suspect", "fail") caller can see exactly criteria fired.  multiple metadata rows match given site/parameter pair first row used warning issued. Gross range (gross_flag) — Observations Min Max flagged "fail".  Observations Tlower Tupper (within fail bounds) flagged "suspect". Spike (spike_flag) — absolute difference consecutive observations compared SpikeFail (fail) SpikeSuspect (suspect).  second observation jump flagged. Rate change (roc_flag) — observation absolute difference previous observation compared RoCStdev standard deviations absolute differences within rolling RoCHours-hour window centered observation. Observations exceeding threshold flagged "suspect". Requires least 3 differences window; otherwise "pass". Flatline (flat_flag) — Counts consecutive observations absolute step previous observation within FlatSuspectDelta (FlatFailDelta) units.  Observations whose run length reaches FlatSuspectN (FlatFailN) flagged. Data sorted Site DateTime processing.

title: Flag continuous monitoring data with QC criteria — utilASRflag
code: contpth <- system.file('extdata/ExampleCont.xlsx', package = 'AquaSensR') metapth <- system.file('extdata/ExampleMeta.xlsx', package = 'AquaSensR')  contdat <- readASRcont(contpth, tz = 'Etc/GMT+5', runchk = FALSE) metadat <- readASRmeta(metapth, runchk = FALSE)  utilASRflag(contdat, metadat, param = 'Water Temp_C') #> Error in utilASRflagupdategupdate(flag, "suspect", vals < meta$Tlower): could not find function "utilASRflagupdategupdate"

title: Apply flatline QC flag — utilASRflagflatline
text: Apply flatline QC flag

title: Apply flatline QC flag — utilASRflagflatline
code: utilASRflagflatline(flag, vals, meta)

title: Apply flatline QC flag — utilASRflagflatline
text: flag character vector current flag values ("pass", "suspect", "fail"). vals numeric vector observed values, length flag. meta single-row data frame metadata parameter checked.  Optional numeric columns FlatSuspectN, FlatSuspectDelta, FlatFailN, FlatFailDelta define run-length tolerance thresholds.  Either pair may absent NA, case level check skipped.

title: Apply flatline QC flag — utilASRflagflatline
text: Updated character flag vector.

title: Apply flatline QC flag — utilASRflagflatline
text: Uses utilASRflagrleflat compute consecutive run lengths. observation flagged "suspect" run length (computed FlatSuspectDelta) reaches FlatSuspectN, "fail" run length (computed FlatFailDelta) reaches FlatFailN.

title: Apply flatline QC flag — utilASRflagflatline
code: flag <- rep("pass", 8) vals <- c(10, 10, 10.005, 10.002, 10.001, 10.003, 12, 12) meta <- data.frame(FlatSuspectN = 3, FlatSuspectDelta = 0.01,                    FlatFailN = 5,    FlatFailDelta = 0.01) utilASRflagflatline(flag, vals, meta) #> Error in utilASRflagupdategupdate(flag, "suspect", rl >= meta$FlatSuspectN): could not find function "utilASRflagupdategupdate"

text: Apply gross range QC flag

title: Apply gross range QC flag — utilASRflaggross
code: utilASRflaggross(flag, vals, meta)

title: Apply gross range QC flag — utilASRflaggross
text: flag character vector current flag values ("pass", "suspect", "fail"). vals numeric vector observed values, length flag. meta single-row data frame metadata parameter checked.  Must contain numeric columns Min, Max, Tlower, Tupper.

title: Apply gross range QC flag — utilASRflaggross
text: Updated character flag vector.

title: Apply gross range QC flag — utilASRflaggross
text: Observations Min Max flagged "fail".  Observations Tlower Tupper (within fail bounds) flagged "suspect". NA threshold values silently skipped.

title: Apply gross range QC flag — utilASRflaggross
code: flag <- rep("pass", 5) vals <- c(-2, 0, 15, 26, 32) meta <- data.frame(Min = -1, Max = 30, Tlower = 0, Tupper = 25) utilASRflaggross(flag, vals, meta) #> Error in utilASRflagupdategupdate(flag, "suspect", vals < meta$Tlower): could not find function "utilASRflagupdategupdate"

what: Compute consecutive run lengths for flatline detection — utilASRflagrleflat
title: Compute consecutive run lengths for flatline detection — utilASRflagrleflat
text: Compute consecutive run lengths flatline detection

title: Compute consecutive run lengths for flatline detection — utilASRflagrleflat
code: utilASRflagrleflat(vals, delta)

title: Compute consecutive run lengths for flatline detection — utilASRflagrleflat
text: vals numeric vector observed values. delta non-negative numeric scalar.  Two adjacent observations considered part flat run absolute difference less equal delta.

title: Compute consecutive run lengths for flatline detection — utilASRflagrleflat
text: Integer vector length vals giving run length position.

title: Compute consecutive run lengths for flatline detection — utilASRflagrleflat
text: position \(\), run length number consecutive observations ending \(\) (including \(\) ) successive absolute difference \(\le\) delta. run length 1 means observation part flat stretch. NA values vals break run.

title: Compute consecutive run lengths for flatline detection — utilASRflagrleflat
Apply rate-of-change QC flag — utilASRflagroc
text: Apply rate--change QC flag

title: Apply rate-of-change QC flag — utilASRflagroc
code: utilASRflagroc(flag, vals, datetimes, meta)

title: Apply rate-of-change QC flag — utilASRflagroc
text: flag character vector current flag values ("pass", "suspect", "fail"). vals numeric vector observed values, length flag. datetimes POSIXct vector observation timestamps, length flag. meta single-row data frame metadata parameter checked.  Optional numeric columns RoCStdev (number standard deviations) RoCHours (full window width hours) control check.  either column absent NA check skipped.

title: Apply rate-of-change QC flag — utilASRflagroc
text: Updated character flag vector.

title: Apply rate-of-change QC flag — utilASRflagroc
text: observation absolute difference previous observation compared RoCStdev × standard deviation absolute differences within RoCHours-hour window centered observation.  observation flagged "suspect" difference exceeds threshold.  least 3 differences must fall within window; otherwise observation skipped.  check produces "suspect" flags; produce "fail" flags.

title: Apply rate-of-change QC flag — utilASRflagroc
code: flag <- rep("pass", 6) vals <- c(10, 10.2, 10.1, 10.3, 15.0, 10.2) datetimes <- as.POSIXct("2024-01-01") + seq(0, 5) * 900  # 15-min intervals meta <- data.frame(RoCStdev = 3, RoCHours = 2) utilASRflagroc(flag, vals, datetimes, meta) #> Error in utilASRflagupdategupdate(flag, "suspect", is_roc): could not find function "utilASRflagupdategupdate"

title: Apply spike QC flag — utilASRflagspike
text: Apply spike QC flag

title: Apply spike QC flag — utilASRflagspike
code: utilASRflagspike(flag, vals, meta)

title: Apply spike QC flag — utilASRflagspike
text: flag character vector current flag values ("pass", "suspect", "fail"). vals numeric vector observed values, length flag. meta single-row data frame metadata parameter checked.  Optional numeric columns SpikeSuspect SpikeFail define absolute-difference thresholds.  Either columns may absent NA, case level check skipped.

title: Apply spike QC flag — utilASRflagspike
text: Updated character flag vector.

title: Apply spike QC flag — utilASRflagspike
text: absolute difference observation preceding one computed.  difference greater equal SpikeSuspect observation flagged "suspect"; greater equal SpikeFail flags "fail". first observation always receives NA difference flagged check.

title: Apply spike QC flag — utilASRflagspike
code: flag <- rep("pass", 5) vals <- c(10, 10.5, 14, 10.2, 10.3) meta <- data.frame(SpikeSuspect = 1.5, SpikeFail = 2.0) utilASRflagspike(flag, vals, meta) #> Error in utilASRflagupdategupdate(flag, "suspect", diffs >= meta$SpikeSuspect): could not find function "utilASRflagupdategupdate"

title: Update QC flag severity — utilASRflagupdate
text: Update QC flag severity

title: Update QC flag severity — utilASRflagupdate
code: utilASRflagupdate(flag, level, condition)

title: Update QC flag severity — utilASRflagupdate
text: flag character vector current flag values; element must one "pass", "suspect", "fail". level scalar character string — new flag level apply ("pass", "suspect", "fail"). condition logical vector length flag.  Elements TRUE whose current flag less severe level upgraded.  NA values condition treated FALSE.

title: Update QC flag severity — utilASRflagupdate
text: Character vector length flag flags updated condition TRUE level severe existing flag.

title: Update QC flag severity — utilASRflagupdate
text: Severity ordered "pass" < "suspect" < "fail".  flag ever upgraded, never downgraded.

title: Update QC flag severity — utilASRflagupdate
code: flag <- c("pass", "pass", "suspect", "fail") utilASRflagupdate(flag, "suspect", c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE)) #> [1] "suspect" "pass"    "suspect" "fail"    utilASRflagupdate(flag, "fail",    c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE)) #> [1] "fail"    "fail"    "suspect" "fail"
